Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: The value for the given key is missing

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: A reference to type with id id cannot be resolved

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: An object cannot be deleted, because of reason

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: The given case for the enum could not be found while deserializing an object

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: The serializable type cannot be deserialized from source because it is not expectedPrimtive

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.name: deletingMultiple
Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: One or more errors occurred while mass-deleting objects. The errors array contains the specific object identifier and error pairs.

Enums/Meow/Error.html#/s:FOO4Meow4Meow5E.abstract: An infinite reference loop has occurred while trying to deserialize an object.

Protocols/Model.html#/s:vE4MeowPS_5Model.abstract: Makes the model hashable, thus unique, thus usable in a Dictionary

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.name: willSave()
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.abstract: Will be called before saving the Model. Throwing from here will prevent the model from saving.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.name: didSave(wasUpdated:)
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.abstract: Will be called when the Model has been saved.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:vP4Meow9Base.name: _id
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:vP4Meow9Base.abstract: The database identifier. You do NOT need to add this yourself. It will be implemented for you using Sourcery.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.name: willDelete()
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.abstract: Will be called when the Model will be deleted. Throwing from here will prevent the model from being deleted.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.name: didDelete()
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FP4Meow9Base.abstract: Will be called when the Model is deleted. At this point, it is no longer in the database and saves will no longer work because the ObjectId is invalidated.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.abstract: Provides Equatable conformance. Just calls === because two instances pointing to the same model cannot exist.

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FE4MeowPS_9B.name: convert(to:)
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:FE4MeowPS_9B.abstract: Converts BaseModel to another KittenCore Type using lossy conversion

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.name: count(_:limiting:skipping:)
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.abstract: Counts the amount of objects matching the query

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.name: findOne(_:)
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.abstract: Returns the first object matching the query

Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.name: instantiateIfNeeded(_:)
Protocols/BaseModel.html#/s:ZFE4MeowPS_9.abstract: Intantiates this instance if needed, or pulls the existing entity from memory when able

Protocols/Model.html.name: Model
Protocols/Model.html.abstract: When implemented, indicated that this is a model that resides at the lowest level of a collection, as a separate entity.

Enums/Meow.html.name: Meow
Enums/Meow.html.abstract: The main object, keeps track of the database
